summary: This is an email correspondence from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding an update to a victim services website. It announces a change in location for a court hearing in the case of United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, scheduled for August 27, 2019, following Epstein's death and a proposed nolle prosequi order.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant in the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: The judge presiding over the hearing scheduled for August 27, 2019, in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Proposed Nolle Prosequi Order
events.description: The United States Attorney proposed a nolle prosequi order to the Court following the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Court Orders Hearing
events.description: The Court ordered a hearing in connection with the proposed nolle prosequi order.

events.title: Scheduled Court Hearing
events.description: A hearing is scheduled at 10:30 a.m. before Judge Berman where counsel for victims and victims will be heard regarding the proposed nolle prosequi.

locations: Federal Courthouse at 40 Foley Square, New York, New York, Courtroom 110
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died prior to August 19, 2019, leading to a proposed nolle prosequi (dismissal) of the criminal case against him.
A court hearing was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to address the proposed dismissal and allow victims and their counsel to be heard.
The hearing location was changed and set to be at 40 Foley Square, New York, in Courtroom 110.
The document is an official update from an Assistant U.S. Attorney intended for a victim and witness services website.
The case docket number is 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), with Judge Richard M. Berman presiding.
